newsitem.title: USA: Visio aquires network design firm's assets.
newsitem.headline: Visio aquires network design firm's assets.

text.p: Visio Corp said Friday it has acquired certain assets of SysDraw Software Co, a privately-held network design and documentation provider.

Visio said it has acquired some of SysDraw's technology and assets for about $6.5 million. Visio may pay additional consideration if sales of the SysDraw products meet certain performance goals within the next three years.
Visio will account for the acquisition as a purchase with about $3.0 million of the purchase price expensed as in-process research and development in the June 1997 quarter.
Excluding the one-time charge in the June 1997 quarter, it is not expected that the acquisition will be dilutive to earnings, Visio said.
The Lombard, Ill., based firm develops, among other things, software programs designed for Visio products.
